intro: Galium arkansanum, commonly known as Arkansas bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the central United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and along stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and often have a hairy texture. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds.
